channel.title: JPanel being a pain :(
channel.description:
I have a JPanel (PacketDisplay) with a GridLayout(PacketDisplay_Layout). The layout is applied to the JPanel. Changed the background color, and it shows the panel has size. getSize() and getBounds() both return [0,0] for the width and height. The rows and columns are defined for the layout as needed.
CODE: http://pastebin.com/ZAaEcnfT
It just isnt showing the sub-elements. I have tried repaint() revalidate() any help?

item.title: JPanel being a pain :(
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:8, topic:545244”][quote author=matzie link=topic=664124.msg4440510#msg4440510 date=1406485105]
The layout of the panel that will display it is a box layout. The parent layout is freeform. posted full code now.

SN: I know i said you can pack a pane. i realized i said this after i posted it. But if you didn’t get the difference between them you probably wouldn’t be able to help me anyways
[/quote]
You are calling initComponents() before you apply anything to the panel. Try calling it after you initialize the panel and it’s other variables.[/quote]
initComponents is where the panel is initialized.

Read full topic

item.title: JPanel being a pain :(
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:7, topic:545244”]The layout of the panel that will display it is a box layout. The parent layout is freeform. posted full code now.

SN: I know i said you can pack a pane. i realized i said this after i posted it. But if you didn’t get the difference between them you probably wouldn’t be able to help me anyways :P[/quote]
You are calling initComponents() before you apply anything to the panel. Try calling it after you initialize the panel and it’s other variables.

Read full topic

item.title: JPanel being a pain :(
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Limits:

I don’t know if this is the answer but did you repack the panel using the “pack()” method?

You can’t pack a panel, you can pack a pane. (Say that 5 times fast)

Read full topic
